item.title: Rotating banners
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Ahmagad your so clever! I wasnt asking how to make an image a link. I found what i was looking for. Incase anyone was wondering then : http://www.htmlbasix.com/banner.shtml . It’s a javascript banner rotator, and makes the banners have links.

The banner changes whenever you refresh and so does the link! Just edit the script they give you to your liking.

Mods remove it if you have to get even those sites approved…

Here is the script below, just put it where you want your banners to go:

<script language="JavaScript">
<!-- Begin
rnd.today=new Date();
rnd.seed=rnd.today.getTime();

function rnd() {
        rnd.seed = (rnd.seed*9301+49297) % 233280;
        return rnd.seed/(233280.0);
};

function rand(number) {
	var result = Math.ceil(rnd()*number);
	if (!result)result++;
        return result
};
var ad_cnt1 = 2;
var ad1 = rand(ad_cnt1);
var link1;
var adBanner1;
var width1
var height1
if (ad1==1) {
link1="url for link 1";
adBanner1="url of image";
width1="468";
height1="60";
alt1="alt text";
}
if (ad1==2) {
link1="url for link 2";
adBanner1="url of image2";
width1="468";
height1="60";
alt1="alt text 2";
}
document.write('<center><a href="' + link1 + '" target="_new">');
document.write('<img src="' + adBanner1 + '" width=' + width1 + ' height=' + height1 + ' border=0 alt="' + alt1 + '"></a>');
document.write('</center>');
// End -->
</SCRIPT>

BTW Pwnd im not that nooby to not know how to make an image a link, i think i just worded my question wrongly.
